byline.contributor: Doris Burke and Elisa Cho contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Carlos Vega was arrested in 2007, accused of killing a man in a bodega. He has been incarcerated with an unresolved case longer than anyone else in New York City.

headline.print_headline: 9 Years in Jail, 3 Trials, 12 Judges and No Verdict in Bronx Murder Case
headline.main: 9 Years in Jail, 3 Trials, 12 Judges and No Verdict in Bronx Murder Case

snippet: Carlos Vega was arrested in 2007, accused of killing a man in a bodega. He has been incarcerated with an unresolved case longer than anyone else in New York City....
abstract: Carlos Vega of Bronx has spent past nine years at Manhattan Detention Complex for alleged 2007 killing of Robert Gaston in bodega; three trials, ending in two mistrials and a hung jury, have yet to yield verdict in case; Vega's situation is extreme example of notoriously slow pace of city's criminal justice system, particularly in Bronx where more than half of New York City's 789 unresolved felony cases reside.
